content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

entries.title: Use Live Translation on iPhone - Apple Support
entries.snippet: Use Live Translation with the Phone app On your iPhone, tap the Phone app to start a phone call like usual. During an active call, tap the More button, then tap Live Translation. If you're not using the speaker or headphones, the call automatically switches to the speaker. If your desired language is not already selected, tap Choose Language.

entries.title: How to use Voice Translate during phone calls on the Pixel 10
entries.snippet:
Google's Pixel 10 introduces a groundbreaking Voice Translate feature for phone calls, allowing real-time translation between languages using AI-generated replicas of each speaker’s voice. Enabled via the Phone app settings, users can choose their language and download additional ones as needed. Once activated, the feature translates both sides of a phone conversation while maintaining the original speakers' tone and style. It also transcribes the dialogue in real time.

Importantly, the Voice Translate function works regardless of whether the person on the other end owns a Pixel 10. Enhanced by the new Tensor G5 chip, the feature operates entirely on-device, does not store any audio or transcription, and functions without an internet connection, ensuring maximum privacy. Voice Translate supports English and several other languages and can be turned off at any time.

This innovation positions the Pixel 10 as a leading Android smartphone, combining powerful AI tools like Voice Translate, improved camera capabilities, and features like Camera Coach and Magic Cue to enhance user experience.

entries.title: The Top New Features in Apple's iOS 26 and iPadOS 26
entries.snippet:
Apple's iOS 26 and iPadOS 26, announced at WWDC 2025, introduce a major visual and functional overhaul, with updates set to roll out in the fall. The new naming convention aligns all Apple platforms under the same version number (26), reminiscent of car model years. A major highlight is the aesthetic transformation through the "Liquid Glass" design, offering semi-transparent interface elements and dynamic app animations.

Significant features in iOS 26 include live translations in Messages, FaceTime, and Phone; call screening; and Visual Intelligence to interpret on-screen content and suggest relevant actions. The Lock Screen adapts dynamically to photos, new customizable emoji combinations are available, and a new Games app catalogs and launches installed titles. Enhancements to core apps include call handling in the Phone app, improved photo management, and upgraded Apple Maps and Wallet functionality. Visuals and app behavior are refined without sacrificing performance or battery life.

iPadOS 26 gains windowed, resizable app support with multitasking upgrades, plus a desktop-like app tiling system and native Preview app for PDF editing. The Files app is revamped with greater customization and usability, further positioning iPads as true laptop replacements. Compatibility requires devices from 2019 or later, excluding older iPhones like the XR and XS.

entries.title: Samsung reveals full list of Android phones receiving a dozen new AI features - check to see if you're eligible
entries.snippet:
Samsung has officially rolled out a major Android update—One UI 6.1—bringing over a dozen new AI-powered features to more than 30 of its devices. The update introduces tools designed to boost functionality and user experience, including advanced translation capabilities, enhanced messaging features, and smart text editing. A key addition is Google’s "Circle to Search," which allows users to perform searches anywhere on screen by simply circling an item. Chat Assist offers real-time message translation within Samsung’s Messages app and WhatsApp, while Live Translate and Interpreter mode support real-time phone call and conversation translation, respectively. Edit Suggestion is another notable tool that lets users change the tone of their writing and make grammar corrections using the Samsung Keyboard.

However, while many flagship models are eligible, some budget Samsung devices will not receive the full suite of new AI features and will only benefit from background software optimizations. These enhancements mark a significant leap in Samsung's integration of AI to enhance productivity, communication, and user customization on mobile devices.

entries.title: Google smashes language barriers with live translation for any earbuds on Android - here's how it works
entries.snippet:
Google has announced a major upgrade to Google Translate, rolling out live translation capabilities to all earbuds on Android devices, currently in beta across the US, Mexico, and India. Previously limited to Pixel Buds, the feature will soon expand globally and to iOS by 2026. This advancement allows more natural and accurate translations by preserving tone, emphasis, and cadence, enhancing understandability in real-time conversations, lectures, and media in over 70 languages.

The upgrade leverages Google’s Gemini AI, which improves translation of slang, idioms, and expressions by interpreting contextual meanings—for example, accurately translating idioms like “stealing my thunder.” Additionally, Google has improved its built-in language learning tools, offering personalized pronunciation feedback, usage tips, and progress tracking features. These updates are expanding to 20 new countries, broadening access to language learning for users in Germany, India, Sweden, Taiwan, and more. This move strengthens Google Translate as a comprehensive language tool for communication and education alike.

entries.title: MeetDot: Videoconferencing with Live Translation Captions
WWDC 2025 recap: Liquid Glass, iOS 26, macOS Tahoe, Apple Intelligence, and all the highlights from Apple
entries.snippet:
At WWDC 2025, Apple introduced major updates across its software platforms, led by a unified visual overhaul called "Liquid Glass" — a glassy, transparent UI design inspired by visionOS. In a major shift, Apple also renamed its software versions to align with release years, introducing iOS 26, macOS 26 "Tahoe", iPadOS 26, watchOS 26, and visionOS 26.

Key highlights include:
- **iOS 26**: AI-powered call screening, voicemail summaries, Hold Assist, Live Translation for calls and messages, and lock screen customization.
- **macOS 26 "Tahoe"**: A new Phone app with iPhone-like features, customizable Control Center and folders, Apple Intelligence integrations in Spotlight, and a revamped Shortcuts app.
- **iPadOS 26**: Major multitasking improvements with resizable windows, Mac-style UI elements, background tasks, and the Preview app.
- **watchOS 26**: An AI Workout Buddy, Notes app, Siri improvements, and new interaction gestures.
- **visionOS 26**: Geographically anchored widgets, enhanced Personas, and support for Logitech pens and PSVR controllers.
- **Games App**: A new central hub across platforms for managing games, integrating social features and leaderboards.

Apple Intelligence played a subtle role, with on-device AI improvements and developer APIs. Public betas begin in July, with full releases expected in the fall.

entries.title: New iPhone feature will shock you
entries.snippet:
At its 2025 Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC), Apple unveiled major updates centered around its new AI system, “Apple Intelligence,” as part of a rebranded iOS 26—skipping from iOS 18 to match the release year. With this sweeping update, Apple introduced a redesigned “Liquid Glass” interface offering dynamic, 3D visuals and responsive UI elements. Key features include enhanced call screening, Hold Assist for managing customer service calls, and smarter messaging with AI-generated summaries. Real-time translation is now available across FaceTime, Phone, and Messages—all processed on-device to ensure privacy.

The update also heralds a smarter Siri, though its full rollout is delayed for more refinement. Apple Watch gains an AI Workout Buddy for personalized fitness coaching, while improvements across Safari, Wallet, Maps, AirPods, and parental controls reinforce ecosystem integration. Apple also unifies its software naming convention across all devices (iOS, macOS, watchOS), emphasizing seamless cross-device functionality. Despite intensified AI competition from other tech giants, Apple asserts its prioritization of privacy over speed. A developer beta is currently available, with a public beta in July and full release expected alongside the iPhone 16 this September.

**Key limitations to be skeptical about**
- **Not universal on all phones** — built-in live call translation is new and limited to certain devices/OS versions.  
- **May need Internet or data** unless the phone’s on-device translation supports offline.  
- **Accuracy and lag** — live translation isn’t perfect; background noise and

accents affect quality. citeturn0search3
